vine.game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • vine.game.Game

  • public class Game
extends Object
    Manages the gameplay on a global level. That is managing level changer persistent objects and resources. * Use the instantiate methods to create new objects of GameObject derived classes. You can add a name parameter to the instantiate method. Use this to declare a name identifier for the new gameobject you can later use, to access the gameobject from other objects in the game. You might check, that the given name parameter is not used for a gameobject already though or the instantiation of the gameobject will fail.
    Author:
    Steffen

                                                         Object... params)
        Parameters:

        params - The optinal arguments of the construct method of the instantiated type.

      • instantiate

        public static final <T extends GameObject> T instantiate(Class<T> type,
                                                         String name,
                                                         Object... params)
        Parameters:
        type - The class type of the new object. Has to be a subclass of Gameobject.
        name - The name of the object. The gameobject can be found by this name throughout the game.
        params - The optinal arguments of the construct method of the instantiated type.
        Returns:
        the newly created gameobject

      • getObjectsByType

        public static final <T extends GameObject> List<T> getObjectsByType(Class<T> type)
        Parameters:
        type - Class that is used to look for objects of.
        Returns:
        A stream object with all gameobject of the given type.

      • getObjectByName

        public static final GameObject getObjectByName(String name)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
